result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy D. Booker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy D. Booker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy D. Booker was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution hearing to be determined through a restititon hearing before Comm Dowse.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit to a DNA sample unless previously provided and pay DNA surcharge unless previously paid.
*Pay restitution plus surcharges.  Through a Restitution Hearing.
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with Eric Peterson or his residence unless otherwise permitted by the court.
  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 3 years and 6 months in the WSP forthwith; 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Sentence is Consecutive to any other sentence.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Atty Komp objects to the amount of restitution being sought as she has not seen any supporting documents.  Restitution Hearing to be determined through a restitution hearing before Comm. Dowse.   Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Angela Komp. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Anderson. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KPD Det. Joshua Hecker sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Komp. Exhibits S-1 and S-2 offered, received, and withdrawn by State. Probable cause found. Information not filed. Arraignment on 6-25-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Jodi Meier. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Meier moves to withdraw as counsel. Court grants motion. Atty. Carmen Lassiter notified the court she will be taking case. Time limits tolled for cause. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 6-4-14 @ 10:15am. Bond continued.
Filed by Atty J Meier.
